intro: Thomandersia hensii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed thomandersia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
